Reviews.Title: “The Maids Stole My Makeup”
Reviews.Author: Kecia M
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience with this Best Western. Relocating to the area, I choose this Best Western to stay for a few nights. After moving into my new apartment and unpacking I found my makeup bag, some costume jewelry and a Los Angeles Book missing. I called and was told that nothing was left behind. After 2 more weeks I started to notice that several of my daughters t-shirts were missing. I guess they were hoping because I had 6 large bags it would take my awhile to miss the items. I know that they stole the first items because the hotel was the last place I saw them. This hotel and personnel horrible. Please do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND STAY AS GOOD AS FIRST”
Reviews.Author: sunnyWashingtonstate
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA frequently and usually don't stay twice at any hotel cause either I did not care for them or prices were raised. I had had such a good stay at the Best Western Canoga Park Motor Inn that I stayed again and I had the same great experience. The hotel seems a bit out of the way but it is pretty central to freeways and is easy to find once you have been there. Parking is ample, breakfast is very generous and staff always friendly and helpful.Hotel is clean. It is close to a convention area but you would never know it and I never hear any noise even when I have stayed in room close to desk and main floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: sunnyWashingtonstate
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to my son and couldn't find any I could afford. I found the site for the BW Canoga Park Motor Inn and almost did not book cause I loved the price but I wasn't sure of the location and thought it would be noisy being next to a convention center, bowling alley and resturant. I was truly amazed how comfortable and quiet this hotel was. It took me a bit longer to get there but it was worth it. The front staff was helpful and friendly and other stafff members were also. There was a good variety of food for breakfast. There was plenty of parking which if you have stayed in LA and areas, parking is a issue. The room was clean and comfortable and I will say again, quiet. Don't pass this hotel up.

Reviews.Title: “Unique opportunity for 24 hour entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Three-men-and-a-babe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to a 24 hour bowling alley. It's not much to look at from the outside, but we had a very pleasant stay. Our room was very clean and quiet. We were there on a Wednesday night. It had a fridge and a microwave. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast area was very small. But they managed to pack in plenty of choices which included hard-boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, hot and cold cereals, fruit and pastries. It was a little too chilly the morning we were there to eat outsid. But I did see tables next to small koi pond. We didn't have time to use the small pool, jacuzzi, or bowling alley. But all looked clean. And I hope that we do have time the next time we visit the area.

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate stay”
Reviews.Author: GeoStovey
Reviews.Content: We discovered bedbugs in our room and had to vacate. The staff were very nice about it and refunded part of our charge and let us cancel our last couple of days reservation, but... not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem with everything new and top notch.”
Reviews.Author: MissouriDaisy
Reviews.Content: Found this lovely renovated motel by chance. The front desk was above and beyond helpful. He gave us directions to the best pizza we have had in ages. The rooms were large and exceptionally clean and value priced. The pool was very nice and the restful fountain and flowers were a plus. We had a easy trip the next day to Santa Monica Pier where we caught a tour bus of Los Angeles. The outside of the building was plain, but just step inside and it is an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, all the usual Amenatives & Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: Socal Flyer
Reviews.Content: Based on favorable reviews we selected the Best Western Canoga Park for a quick overnight while visiting in the area, and are pleased to report the reviews are accurate. Front desk check-in was friendly & efficient, the room clean & quiet. Although this is an older facility it appeared to be recently renovated and in excellent condition. My old eyes particularily liked the crisply new, well lit bathroom! Has all the necessities: In-room coffee, microwave, fridge, wi-fi (get log-in info from the desk), a decent continental breakfast, pool, etc. No on-site restaurant but there are several near-by. There is an adjoining bowling alley which boasts a cocktail lounge, though. Price was competitive in the area and we got a further discount by booking on-line. All in all, a very satisfactory stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great diner, super cheap!”
Reviews.Author: cb69
Reviews.Content: We went to visit friends who live nearby. They'd been to the bowling alley before, and they eat at the restaurant on a regular basis, so they suggested this motel. The staff at the motel made us feel very comfortable and safe. The room was clean and cozy. We really enjoyed the excellent food at the diner, so much nicer than generic fast food. And both the motel and the diner offered great service for very affordable prices. We didn't get to go bowling last time, but we're going to make a point of it next time.

Reviews.Title: “A little 'run down' feel, but great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: camjam73
Reviews.Content: While I probably wouldn't venture out into the surrounding area alone at night (Winnetka rather than Canoga Park), the area isn't that bad. Just be sure to lock your car and remove valuables from sight... That said, our room was surprisingly nice. Come to think of it, the whole hotel stood out from its surroundings (in a good way!) We were a little surprised, however, to find out that the elevator wasn't working. Had to haul all of our heavy luggage up the stairs (which we had to be careful not to touch because of the wet paint signs). Hopefully, we just caught the hotel at a bad time. So if you are willing to tolerate a slightly "run down" atmosphere, the rooms stand out as a nice retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: a1943jmc
Reviews.Content: Very nice for a short stay. Staff was friendly and comfortable. There was no problem locating our reservation and both chech-in and check-out were very quick. Beds were very comfortable. Pillows are very plump and soft. Windows open. Hallways are interior, so are very secure. Pool is in enclosed courtyard, with plenty of tables and chairs. For breakfast, we were given vouchers for an adjacent restaurant which was very good. We chose from the special voucher menu, but you can choose any breakfast you like and pay the difference. If you forget something, complimentary toiletries are available. Parking is very close to entrance, which is monitored with a security camera. Don't let the bowling alley put you off. Rooms are very quiet. We slept with the window open and there was only very minor traffic noise. Very definitely would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Better then it used to be.....the”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here was back in 1997 and it was scary. Since then they have remodeld it and it is much nicer. My only issue was they are VERY stingy with the towels. I have no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I drove my friend and her two kids (12&14) to California for a week's vacation of all the sites. The motel was smack dab in the middle of places we wanted to go. A bowling alley and restaurant are also attached. When we arrived at the motel, the first thing that struck us was the pool! It was beautiful and probably the cleanist one I've seen! I've traveled enough to be impressed. The area seemed middle class, but safe. For the rate, our room was perfect! Right by the pool where the kids spent alot of time. They also enjoyed the bowling alley next store every night, and the restaurant delivers and has wonderful food. The best part though was the staff. They were very friendly and personable. You could tell they all felt like family. We even met the owner of the place, who was equally friendly. The kids cried when we had to leave. They've alreadly been contacted by the friends they made there. We'll be back!
